revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Alien |class=Start |importance=Top}} {{WikiProject Film |class=Start}} {{WikiProject Science Fiction |class=Start |importance=Low |type=Article}} {{WikiProject Horror |class=Start |importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Fictional characters |class=start}} }} == Corrections == The year the Ripley was born in and the year that ''Alien'' takes place in were given in Ripley's biography and the Nostromo Flight Plan, both of which are available on the Alien DVD, which means they probably are canon. I've also removed the mention of Ripley's daughter dying of cancer. In the movie Burke never said what the cause of death was. The line about her dying of cancer is from the script. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/218.214.143.84|218.214.143.84]] ([[User talk:218.214.143.84|talk]]) 12:45, 16 September 2006 (UTC) :Another thing, Clemens mentioning that there hasn't been a case of cholera in 200 is probably a mistake on the part of the script writers of Alien 3. The dates were clearly indicated on the Alien DVD. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/218.214.143.84|218.214.143.84]] ([[User talk:218.214.143.84|talk]]) 12:49, 16 September 2006 (UTC) ::If it's not in the film or explicitly confirmed by writers/producers, it's not canon. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/73.170.106.20|73.170.106.20]] ([[User talk:73.170.106.20|talk]]) 20:28, 4 February 2015 (UTC) == Gender stereotype? == I'd like to see a section added on the impact of the character and her role in changing gender stereotypes...never heard this before, but it could definitely use some elaboration. [[User:208.38.59.91|208.38.59.91]] 00:37, 11 February 2007 (UTC) == Merge == The "clone" should be merged with Ellen Ripley. It's essentially the same fictional character, just at a different moment in her fictional life. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 15:38, 14 March 2007 (UTC) :You know what?I think we should merge it.Even though I have no right to share my opinion. -Every guy at a truck stop —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/65.90.11.51|65.90.11.51]] ([[User talk:65.90.11.51|talk]]) 17:14, 28 October 2007 (UTC) ::Agreed. Should be merged with Ellen Ripley under a sub-heading. [User:203.206.23.150|203.206.23.150]] 06:15, 19 March 2007 (UTC) :::No. Ellen Ripley had a life before the clone, a life extremely relevant to a generation of women (inc. me) so no - the clone is a device, Ellen Ripley is an icon. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/84.69.187.238|84.69.187.238]] ([[User talk:84.69.187.238|talk]]) 21:25, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::We aren't debating who's an icon, we are talking about relevance to the article, and the clone doesn't deserve her own page. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 21:28, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::::Hmmmn. To my mind, the clone deserves maybe a page, which I won't do, but Ellen Ripley deserves to not be subsumed into the clone page? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 21:34, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::::Explain how the clone fits wikipedia's [[WP:Notability|notability]] requirements? She was a clone of an iconic character, so she should be on that page. This isn't like [[Clark Kent]] and [[Superman]] here, it's like [[The Shadow]]. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 21:40, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::::::No mate, that's mad - Ellen Ripley escaped and flamethrowered the aliens WAY before she finally got cloned - there is no way the Ripley clone is Ripley. I think you are a Weyland Yutani servitor, and I congratulate you on that. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 21:47, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::::::Please understand that Wikipedia is an encyclopedia, not some fancruft website. You have to follow the policies and guidelines of this site, and the "clone" doesn't fit those guidelines. She isn't notable. She's a footnote of the character of Ellen Ripley. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 21:50, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::::::::That's great, I'm not a fan maniac anyway, Ellen Ripley is an established character and the clone doean't touch that. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 21:57, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::::::::Again, are you following what the discussion is even about? It's about the merging of the clone article to this article. It has nothing to do with Ripley's iconic status, or established history, it's about the clone. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 21:58, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::::::::::Okay I've maybe missed something, I though this was about Clone and Ellen, will go back and check that... —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:02, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::::::::::Nope, I'm right, Ripley the character isn't Ripley the clone. Not at all. Wikipedia may be many things but innaccurate, no. Ripley the clone is a device made up over a decade after Ripley the warrant officer who escaped the alien. 1979. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:07, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ←It's about the article pages. Currently, There is an Ellen Ripley article, and a separate article on her clone. See the tag at the top of the article mainspace. The merger is about moving the Clone article to this article. Your "system of thinking" would mean that we should separate Luke Skywalker the moisture farmer from his Jedi Knight counterpart. Technically they are two different points in the character's history. The Clone is not a "new" character, it's a spin from the original character, and thus it's information should be on this page. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 22:09, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :Yeah, go for it. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:11, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::Where's the review of ADF's EXCELLENT novelisations of this series? We may not agree on wkikipeajaness (mostly coz I'm new to it) but those novels... where are they mentioned? and why not? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:17, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::Are you gonna bite my smoochie if I post bits of ADF's novels>? Like to know before I bother posting. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:22, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::Why are you posting anything? This is a discussion about a merger. Please go read [[WP:5|Wiki's 5 pillars]] and then come back. [[User:Bignole|'''  BIGNOLE ''']] [[User talk:Bignole|(Contact me)]] 22:24, 22 March 2007 (UTC) :::::I'm posting because I thought I had something to add. You don't, you pointed me on, great. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chandranova|Chandranova]] ([[User talk:Chandranova|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chandranova|contribs]]) 22:31, 22 March 2007 (UTC) ::::::I agree, the clone page should be merged -- seems to me as though they are indistinguishable from each other except to the most fannish fan. [[User:Accounting4Taste|Accounting4Taste]] 21:17, 30 April 2007 (UTC) :::::::A way to do this would be to post the article about the clone in an "alternateive versions" section of the article, or to divide the biography by movies, in which case the clone would be discussed under "resurection" —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/81.226.255.215|81.226.255.215]] ([[User talk:81.226.255.215|talk]]) 11:20, 11 June 2007 (UTC) ::::::::I think the clone should get a subcategory in the main Ellen Ripley article. --[[User:DrBat|DrBat]] 22:06, 12 July 2007 (UTC) :::::::::Support merge per Bignole. The Ripley clone is another part of Ripley's life and so should be in the main article. [[User:Bowsy|Bowsy]] ([[Wikipedia:Editor review/Bowsy|review me!]]) 12:20, 22 October 2007 (UTC) ::::::::::Merging to me would just be confusing to the reader, and is not necessary. I am a fan of the Alien series, but not over-zealous about it. So I guess I would oppose this. [[User:Coccyx Bloccyx|Coccyx Bloccyx]] ([[User talk:Coccyx Bloccyx|talk]]) 18:04, 26 November 2007 (UTC) :::::::::::'''Merge''' Um seriously, why are there two?--[[User:Marhawkman|Marhawkman]] ([[User talk:Marhawkman|talk]]) 18:19, 16 December 2007 (UTC) ::::::::::::I say keep them apart. The Clone may share Ripley's memories and DNA but they are different people all together. [[User:FaithLehaneTheVampireSlayer|FaithLehaneTheVampireSlayer]] 15:27, 30 December 2007 (UTC) :Number Eight is distinct enough to warrant her own subsection, but not enough to warrant a whole separate article, so I've reorganized the article to reflect this. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/73.170.106.20|73.170.106.20]] ([[User talk:73.170.106.20|talk]]) 20:30, 4 February 2015 (UTC) == In-universe style == The whole article reads like a biography, with no mention of the movies the events took place in, besides the intro at the top of the page. Apart from just adding movie titles in parentheses, what can be done to fix this? [[User:Pooneil|Pooneil]] 22:49, 4 April 2007 (UTC) == Fair use rationale for Image:Ellen ripley.jpg == [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:Ellen ripley.jpg]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in '''this''' Wikipedia article constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]]. Please go to [[:Image:Ellen ripley.jpg|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to ensure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page. If there is other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images lacking such an explanation can be deleted one week after being tagged, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. [[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] ([[User talk:BetacommandBot|talk]]) 21:18, 13 February 2008 (UTC) == Daughter? Other details? == The article lacks specific details and citations. For example, in what version of the movie/script was her daughter mentioned? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/99.23.137.41|99.23.137.41]] ([[User talk:99.23.137.41|talk]]) 03:30, 13 August 2009 (UTC) :It definitely does need more citations, but FWIW the daughter bit comes from the special edition of ''Aliens'' (available on DVD & as part of the Quadrilogy set). --[[User:IllaZilla|IllaZilla]] ([[User talk:IllaZilla|talk]]) 06:03, 13 August 2009 (UTC) ::Do other details even exist in the canon? [[User:Drakkenfyre|Drakkenfyre]] ([[User talk:Drakkenfyre|talk]]) 06:57, 1 December 2010 (UTC) == Ten Months? == In the first film, it was remarked that it would take ten months to get back to Earth; however, from the dialogue, the one who spoke mentioned the slowdown time and getting into orbit (I can't remember the quote verbatim). This seems to imply that they would have gotten to Earth sooner had they not stopped and taken the time to (apparently) decelerate, then accelerate again. Can anybody clarify this? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/129.15.127.221|129.15.127.221]] ([[User talk:129.15.127.221|talk]]) 05:04, 6 December 2009 (UTC) :Seems like common sense. If you stop traveling, set the ship down on a planetoid, and have a little adventure, naturally it's going to take you longer to get home than if you hadn't stopped at all. --[[User:IllaZilla|IllaZilla]] ([[User talk:IllaZilla|talk]]) 05:09, 6 December 2009 (UTC) ::Not what the Original Poster intended. I think they were comparing fictional space speeds. Aliens tends to use an older more "Einstein-ian" view of space travel, similar to the Slowerthanlight website. As such, the ship has mass which needs to be accelerated up and down (in space) before travel between stars. THUS: It took Ripley 57 years to reach Earth because her ship and life pod were not "at speed" as the ship was before they responded to the distress call. The Nostromo had to have had powerful engines to get to speed, and most of the ship must have been fuel storage, which is the only explanation (beyond just plain looking cool on camera) for the size of the ships in the Alien movies and the tiny crews — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/75.43.18.19|75.43.18.19]] ([[User talk:75.43.18.19|talk]]) 18:52, 6 November 2011 (UTC) :::[[WP:NOTFORUM|What does any of this have to do with the Wikipedia article on the character?]] --[[User:IllaZilla|IllaZilla]] ([[User talk:IllaZilla|talk]]) 22:25, 6 November 2011 (UTC) == Character Description == How come there's so many referenced stories and history but no actual description of the character?--[[Special:Contributions/119.193.155.93|119.193.155.93]] ([[User talk:119.193.155.93|talk]]) 09:37, 28 December 2011 (UTC) :Because most people confuse "character description" for "extensive plot rehash". --[[User:IllaZilla|IllaZilla]] ([[User talk:IllaZilla|talk]]) 09:46, 28 December 2011 (UTC) == Significant changes == I've tried to improve the page. I've made precisions, and found many sources. However I am french and, although I have done my been, I think I have made many misspellings. Please be kind to correct my mistakes, because I can't do better alone. --[[User:Hyliad|Hyliad]] ([[User talk:Hyliad|d]]), 00:56, 16 january 2011 (TTC) == the article needs more information on the character being in the alien games == alien trilogy isnt mentioned. i cant see alien 3(super nintendo game) anywhere in the article. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/84.208.59.120|84.208.59.120]] ([[User talk:84.208.59.120|talk]]) 10:56, 12 April 2012 (UTC) : Be Bold, 84. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/208.38.59.161|208.38.59.161]] ([[User talk:208.38.59.161|talk]]) 23:26, 17 June 2012 (UTC) == Best of... == On [http://www.film.com/movies/best-action-heroes-movies film.com], Ripley is ranked as the second greatest action hero of all time, after James Bond. Should this be included in the section where it currently stands the following? "Ripley has been selected as the eighth-greatest hero in American cinema history by the American Film Institute, as the fifth-coolest hero in pop culture by Entertainment Weekly,[2] the ninth-greatest movie character ever by Empire (the highest-placing female of the list), and the eighth-best movie character of all time by Premiere,[3] In 2011, John Scalzi called her "Clearly the Best Female Character in Scifi Film"."
